content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})
    # Initialize an empty vector to store the filtered names
    filtered_names = Vector{String}()

    # Iterate over each word in the list
    for name in words
        # Check if the first letter of the word is uppercase
        if startswith(name, uppercase(name[1]))
            # Append the name to the filtered list if it passes the check
            push!(filtered_names, name)
        end
    end

    # Return the filtered list of names
    return filtered_names
end
```

This function iterates over a vector of strings (`words`) and checks each word using `startswith` to see if it begins with its first letter in uppercase. If so, the word is added to a new vector called `filtered_names`. After iterating over all words, the `filtered_names` vector is returned as the filtered list of names that start with a capital letter.
